section.title: SimME - Development Environment
section.p: In here there are several tips and advices on how to help develop SimME. As developing for the Java 2 Micro Edition (J2ME) is not very complicated, this document is made short. It won't be a waste of time to read through this. If so then it was not very much time.
As this site will be changed soon, our Wiki now contains a page dedicated to development documentation

section.title: What do you need?
section.p: Sure, there are a lot of different possibilities to develop for J2ME. This section shows the way we do it.

tr.td: This is the main development tool used. Compiling of sources, package deployment, emulation, etc. The newest version can be found at the WTK site
Needed to run the tests. www.junit.org

Any IDE is possible to edit your code. Some tools integrate more with the wireless tookit, while others do not. The choice depends on your taste. See a list of possible tools at http://wireless.java.sun.com/allsoftware/index.html#midpdev (we use eclipse, which is not listed there)

section.title: How to use the Sources
section.p: Create a directory in the apps directory of the WT. Put the sources without the testing package into the src directory within this newly created directory. Now you have two possibilities. Either you create a new project pointing to this direcotry, or you use our .jad file and put it into the bin directory.
The testpackages may be put somewhere else (e.g. testsrc).
